body: Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3479 to not forget about it, planning to work on it end of this month if nobody beats me at it
Adressed comments, hopefully this time is the good one ;)

Run Java AvroIO Performance Test
@jacobmarble How is `--awsCredentialsProvider` intended to be used? I'm perhaps missing something but I was not able to point it to my own custom provider.
@sduskis what do you think if we validate if table exist only in case bigtable options were provided or value provider has accessible value, in other cases we will not do it?

@dmytroivanov4206: Given the inherent constraint in templates and validation, we don't have a choice in the matter.  I'm fine with limiting the validation to non-template scenarios.  Templates will fail at runtime if the table does not exist.
Having smaller elements is a good idea.

I agree with @iemejia about `IOTestPipelineOptions`. Eek! When I was investigating the build breakage, I found the JIRA and then through it this PR. I was very surprised to find this practice lurking in our integration tests. It reminds me of the broken `jenkins-precommit` integration test profile in the examples. Gradle has already made it easy to fix the examples config - maybe it can help here?

Can we expedite a decision on either fixing it or disabling it temporarily, because it breaks the postcommit signal?

Agree to the `IOTestPipelineOption`, it was just to be consistent.

I propose to update this PR:
1. first excluding the test to allow the build to pass asap
2. change the IT accordingly
I'm updating this PR
Gentle reminder @jkff, can you PTAL, we want this one merged if possible so we can rebase on it the write support. Hopefully on time for 2.3.0
First step implemented: disable it on KinesisIO.

This PR is a walk-around related to [BEAM-3480](issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3480) - it forces Jenkins to schedule PerfKit jobs on subset of workers on which there are no issues. **The actual problem still persists and should be solved.**
@chamikaramj PTAL, thanks.
retest this please
Run Java PostCommit
@kennknowles : adressed the comments, thanks for the review.

R: @alanmyrvold Alan, can you take a look ?

cc: @jasonkuster
Is this for all Jenkins jobs ? If so this sounds like a serious issue and we should try to find the root cause instead of limiting the number of executors.
Run seed job

I've just pushed a minor fix for initial minimum value for the Kinesis watermark. Previously it was set to minimal value allowed in BoundedWindow but that caused some problems in certain situations when requesting CloudWatch metrics. Now it's set to "now - kinesis max retention period".
Thanks JB

@chamikaramj  It's on all Jenkins jobs running PerfKit and I totally agree that root cause should be fixed. However in case issue is hard to fix or time-consuming this walk-around could be merged - it's up to you.

Once there is a JSON -> AwsCredentialsProvider mapping it will be expected that --awsCredentialsProvider={JSON for AwsCredentialsProvider} can be used. My last comment to @jacobmarble was to add support for these mappings for the common AwsCredentialsProvider types (or find a library that does this already.) Since the mapping doesn't yet exist, its hard to say what the mapping looks like.
Rebased on hopefully-now-green `master`. I will merge when I get test confirmation now.
Run Dataflow ValidatesRunner
@tgroh I think this will resolve some shading pain you are encountering, too.
Did you want to make the smaller elements change in this PR or a separate one?
Hi, just to let you all know that I'm still around. Work has me busy with other projects right now, so it's harder to find time for this last fix to the PR.
Run Dataflow ValidatesRunner

I'm with @sduskis, skip validation if a required parameter for validation is missing. Also add tests to show that validation is being skipped if the parameters are from value providers that are not accessible.

Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
Out of curiosity - where does this come from?
This is the folder for the RocksDb local state files of Samza processors. By default it will be created under the current folder, which is runners/samza/ when running the tests. In real deployment we set a Samza env var for the location. --- *[runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java, line 46 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340#-L2QxfBrdvudRv-Bm-BX:-L3-bLwz0Lv-TSZ-qqsp:b19e7s8) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/8b6500ab69a4b159629d07c6d2fa79c4a3fd002d/runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java#L46)):*
Previously, kennknowles (Kenn Knowles) wrote
To make sure I understand this - it means that every Samza source will be set to this same max parallelism?
Right. This is similar to Flink's parallism, and it's used by all the sources in Samza. The subsequent Samza tasks will be created based on the actual splits returned from the source. Do we allow user to set splits/parallism at individual source level? I am curious how other runners like dataflow split the sources. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340)*
R: @robertwb
Thanks!

Review status: 11 of 61 files reviewed at latest revision, 4 unresolved discussions, some commit checks failed. --- *[runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java, line 46 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340#-L2QxfBrdvudRv-Bm-BX:-L3-nKROD2VNTCnBD-ga:b-d4loov) ([raw file](https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/8b6500ab69a4b159629d07c6d2fa79c4a3fd002d/runners/samza/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/samza/SamzaPipelineOptions.java#L46)):*
Previously, xinyuiscool wrote
Right. This is similar to Flink's parallism, and it's used by all the sources in Samza. The subsequent Samza tasks will be created based on the actual splits returned from the source. Do we allow user to set splits/parallism at individual source level? I am curious how other runners like dataflow split the sources.
One more question: for Samza, it'll be nice we know the partitions of a Unbounded/Bounded source if it is partitioned, e.g Kafka. With this I can split a source by its partition count by default and each partition will be a split. This is how Samza itself works today by default, so it's consistent with the current model. Seems right now I don't see such metadata being exposed in the general UnboundedSource/BoundedSource. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/apache/beam/4340)*
Jenkins: retest this please.
Looks good. Will merge when tests pass; please ping me if you notice that they've passed and I forgot to merge :)
Run Java TextIO Performance Test HDFS

Addressed review comments, ready for review. As for the "run locally" logic, let me know if you would prefer to just remove that. I left it there for ease of locally running the pipeline and making sure everything actually ran correctly since what we currently run is only to make sure the transforms can be built and all validations pass, but the pipeline itself doesn't run.

Yes, I agree that running a ProcessFn should be done without late-data dropping. Can you use ProcessFnRunner? That's what direct runner uses (and Dataflow runner uses something almost identical but slightly customized to the environment of the Dataflow worker).

Hmm this object is not supposed to be serialized. This PR will make it simply deserialize as null, and I'm highly doubtful that the code will work correctly after that. Could you post a more complete deserialization error by running with `-Dsun.io.serialization.extendedDebugInfo=true` ? I wonder if Apex runner is serializing something unnecessarily.
@sduskis , @lukecwik  I have updated code to reflect your comments, please take a look and I will add more tests to the BigtableConfig/IOTest afterwards.

BTW are we assuming that there's an already running Kubernetes cluster in Jenkins with a proper kubeconfig ? This might not be the case.

Does it make a difference if we try to run the Jenkins test against a Kubernetes cluster running in GKE ?

cc: @jasonkuster
r:@herohde r:@lostluck
Thanks. LGTM
Please rerun tests

Yes. That loop's role is simply to get Fn API messages and route them to a goroutine for actually handling. It should not be blocking on anything other than waiting on the next message. gRPC requires only one goroutine to be consuming from a stream. This is the receive goroutine, similar to the earlier comments around having a singular goroutine for sends. I'll add a comment to that effect. The goroutine requirements for gRPC are subtle and are inconveniently buried in godoc.

The additional parallelism definitely works, as I've verified progress reports show updates of source progress while a bundle was being handled. Without this code, the progress reports don't get seen until the bundle is handled.

The expectation is that the runner harness controls the parallelism. There's currently no Fn API hook that I'm aware of for the runner to tell the SDK how many threads/goroutines to use. My TODO comments about protection were intended to be an acknowledgement of this point. However, it's not clear to me what value should be used as a throttle. I'm not sure a sync.WaitGroup is the proper concurrency control since each bundle is done based on the work of a single goroutine. I imagine there would be a semaphore representing the number of simultaneous bundles we'd want to handle.  If the goroutine for the bundle can't immediately execute, it blocks on the semaphore. That leaves the network goroutine free to continue to handle control messaging.
New comments pushed. PTAL.
Assign me when this is ready for review.

I just modified the coder. Tell me if it's ok.

Hi Eugene,

I'm busy with something else and will not be able to test anytime soon. The
code I modified, I only copied from FileBasedSink.DynamicDestinations - it
appeared to be the same code (except not updated with transient modifier)
for BQIO.DynamicDestinations. It would seem someone faced similar issue
with FileBasedSink and made the changes there, but I'm not familiar enough
with beam to comment on whether it should be Serialized or not.

Regards,
Shashank

R: @charlesccychen

> BTW are we assuming that there's an already running Kubernetes cluster in Jenkins with a proper kubeconfig ? This might not be the case.
> Does it make a difference if we try to run the Jenkins test against a Kubernetes cluster running in GKE ?

That's right: we need kubectl and kubeconfig present on all jenkins executors given the previous JDBC test runs. Those indeed seems not to be there yet as @chamikaramj  mentioned. Seems that we need to provide all this before we add the jenkins job. By "all this", I mean:

 - kubectl, installed on all executors, not only on 'beam1'
 - kubernetes cluster instance hosted on GKE
 - kubeconfig available on all executors, that allows a connection to the GKE cluster instance. IMO this file shouldn't be in beam's repository as it contains sensitive credentials
 - probably it would be convinient to have:  KUBECONFIG environment variable on Jenkins that would point to the config destination

Given the kubernetes problems and other jenkins problems (the "permission denied" problem mentioned in JIRA [3480](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3480)) I decided not to enable the jdbc job again yet (hence new commit, reverting the file change). Still the test can be run manually using io-it-suite/io-it-suite-local profiles on any kubernetes cluster, locally. This is still valueable. Let's add the jenkins job in a separate PR while kubernetes is setup properly on jenkins and jenkins itself works properly.

@jasonkuster Could you help with setting the proper kubernetes infrastructure?

Removed jenkins job due to the reasons described in [4392](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4392#issuecomment-358304303) pull request. The job should be added in a separate PR after the problems are solved.

@chamikaramj could you take a look?

Apologies for being late to ask, but would you consider adding a `--awsEndpoint` option, to allow this to work with other S3 implementations, like IBM Cloud Object Storage? I can provide the changes as a diff.

Full, but probably obvious disclosure: I work at IBM. :-)

If it's too late for this pull request, I can put up as a separate one after this is merged with master.

@johnmac-ibm Excellent idea (the serviceEndpoint one) also to debug with a docker emulator like localstack. We recently added this also for kinesis so we can try to make it homogeneous once we unify all amazon-web-services IOs in the future.
I'm testing on a concrete Cassandra instance (using IT).
